result.execSummary:
The defendant Luke W Hennigan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
Comply with Sex Offender Registry
No internet access unless prior permission from agent.  
No contact with anyone under 18 years old without agent approval. 
Cannot live within 1,000 feet of park, daycare or school.  
Absolute sobriety.  Full-time employment or perform 5 job searches per week. 
Any counseling and conditions recommended.  
Provide a DNA sample

records.addlTxt:
01:55 pm  Defendant Luke W Hennigan in court with attorney Christopher Paul Ehrfurth.  Gregory A. Parker appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
PSI received and reviewed by all parties before court.  
Joint recommendation, sentenced as follows:  
State prison:  1 yr initial confinement and 3 yrs ES concurrent to 14CF232  both counts 1 and 2.  $100 fine and costs each count.  $250 DNA surcharge and sample
Sentencing hearing on February 20, 2020 at 01:15 pm.

03:23 PM Defendant Luke W Hennigan in court with attorney Christopher Paul Ehrfurth.  Gregory A. Parker appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea questionnaire received and reviewed.  Atty. Ehrfurth states the agreement on the record.  Defendant enters pleas to counts 1 & 2.    Court advises party of their rights, gives citizenship/deportation admonition, finds factual basis, accepts defendant's waiver of their rights, the plea made, and finds guilty of counts 1 & 2.  Remaining counts are dismissed, but read-in.  Parties agree to having a pre-sentence investigation and psycho-sexual evaluation.  Court orders the pre-sentence investigation and psycho-sexual evaluation.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 20, 2020 at 01:15 pm.

10:50 am Defendant Luke W Hennigan in court with attorney Christopher Paul Ehrfurth.  Gregory A. Parker appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  A future plea date requested.  DA Parker will ask for a PSI and Psychosexual evaluation at the plea hearing.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 18, 2019 at 11:30 am.
Status hearing on August 21, 2019 at 03:30 pm.

Atty Ehrfuth - dees resolution is close, evaluation has been completed, believes offer could come today.  Court advises parties this case is getting old, questions examination of hard drives.  DA Parker - exams are completed, were waiting for report from Dr. Cummings (have now received).  Parties request status in 30 days.  Status hearing scheduled for August 21, 2019 at 03:30 pm.  Status hearing scheduled for August 21, 2019 at 03:30 pm.

transcript of proceedings held 12-8-16

10:40am. MOTION TO RELEASE MIRROR IMAGES
Defendant Luke W Hennigan in court with attorney Christopher Paul Ehrfurth.  Scott E. Niemi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Ehrfurth - clarifies motion - release of images to Regional Computer Crimes Education & Enforcement group in Missouri.  DA Parker - provides discovery statute to Court and Atty Ehrfurth.  Atty Ehrfurth - using statute 971.23(11).  DA Parker - protective order would need to be signed.  Atty Ehrfurth - requests disclosure to Regional Computer Crimes Education & Enforcement Group, his expert would have access to this facility.  DA Parker requests testimony re: discovery.  Det. C.G. sworn & testifies.  Cross-exam.  Objection - out of scope of today's hearing - overruled.  Court questions State's opinion on transfer/encryption of files.  DA Parker - Material cannot be turned over to DE by statute, No sworn affidavit attached to Motion, making motion deficient, unaware if Clayton PD is willing to accept files.  Cites State v. Bowser (provides copy to Court and Atty E.) Closing statements.  Court -Statute reads " Any copy in possession of State shall remain in custody of law enforcement/Court and be made reasonably available to defenses."    Research should be conducted under the jurisdiction of the State of WI.  Based on what Court has found so far, Forensic examiner to be allowed to view the material under the supervision of the Shawano Co. Sheriff's Dept.  New evidence in support of motion can be reviewed in the future.  Motion denied.  If protective order required Court will sign.  State to draft order.  DA Parker questions expense in future to bring people from Missouri to testify at trial.  Atty E questions option of viewing at DCI in Milw. or Madison.  Court comments on expenses/copy to send to Milw./Madison vs. Shawano/Green Bay.
for Production and Release of Mirror Images to Defense

Defendant Luke W Hennigan in court with attorney Christopher T. Froelich.  Catharine Denise White appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Time limits waived for preliminary hearing.  Atty Froelich requests the court reduce the bond to $2500 cash or signature.  State asks for the bond to be increased to $10,000 in light of violations of bond.  Motion to reduce is denied.  Judge increases the bond to $7500 and adds conditions.
Date for PH to be set off record.

Attny Ron Haacke appears with defendant for bond only.  Defendant will be hiring private counsel.  DA indicates additional charges may be filed.  Attny Niemi requests a $5,000.00 cash bond.
